IO
IO :: module

Provides basic input and output operations for interacting with the console.

Functions
print
print :: (
msg
 = 
""
)

Outputs a message to stdout without a newline.

Parameters
msg

(String) The message to print. Defaults to empty string.

Returns
Unit

Represents no meaningful value (i.e. just a side effect).

println
println :: (
msg
 = 
""
)

Outputs a message to stdout followed by a newline.

Parameters
msg

(String) The message to print. Defaults to empty string.

Returns
Unit

Represents no meaningful value (i.e. just a side effect).

Note

This may be identical to `print` if the runtime automatically adds a newline.

read
read :: (
msg
 = 
"Enter text"
)

Prompts the user with a message and reads a line from stdin.

Parameters
msg

(String) The prompt message shown before input. Defaults to "Enter text".

Returns
String

The user input as a string.
